metadata.Title: CVE-2020-17541 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Libjpeg-turbo all version have a stack-based buffer overflow in the "transform" component. A remote attacker can send a malformed jpeg file to the service and cause arbitrary code execution or denial of service of the target service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.6
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.6
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.6
libturbojpeg - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> probably not exploitable, if it is, it's a DoS only https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/issues/392#issuecomment-562332507

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.6').
